name: Idiopathic Hypocomplementemic Tubulointerstitial Nephritis
chief_complaint: I've been feeling extremely tired, my legs are swollen, and my urine looks foamy
treatment: possible renal biopsy for definitive diagnosis
prognosis: Guarded; depends on early intervention and response to immunosuppression. May progress to end-stage renal disease in refractory cases.
description: A rare form of tubulointerstitial nephritis characterized by complement activation (primarily alternative pathway) without identifiable autoimmune or infectious etiology. Presents with acute or subacute renal failure, proteinuria, and hypocomplementemia. Distinct from lupus nephritis or post-infectious glomerulonephritis by serological markers.
